You can only benefit from one instance of this feature at a time.
At 20th level, you can increase Wisdom and Dexterity Upto a maximum of 26.

classFeature.name: Diamond Soul
entries: Beginning at 14th level, your mastery of ki grants you proficiency in all saving throws.
Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 ki point to reroll it and take the second result.

classFeature.name: Timeless Body
entries: At 15th level, your ki sustains you so that you suffer none of the frailty of old age, and you can't be aged magically. You can still die of old age, however. In addition, you no longer need food or water.
Additionally, whenever you finish a short rest, you may reduce any exhaustion remaining by 1 level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Monastic Tradition feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain one feature granted by your Monastic Tradition.

classFeature.name: Empty Body
entries: Beginning at 18th level, you can use your action to spend 4 ki points to become {@condition invisible} for 1 minute. During that time, you also have resistance to all damage but force damage.
Additionally, you can spend 8 ki points to cast the {@spell astral projection} spell, without needing material components. When you do so, you can't take any other creatures with you.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Perfect Self
entries: You have honed your body and mind to new heights. Your Dexterity and Wisdom scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 26.

classFeature.name: Memorize Spell
entries: Studying your spellbook for 1 minute,you can exend mental and magical effort to memorize a spell. Choose one spell of level 1 or higher from your spellbook that you don't have prepared. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest, and you forget the spell you memorized whenever you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Mysticshift Duelist
entries: Originating from the elite Cassius recon groups, Mysticshift Duelists blend emerging scientific insights and a deepening arcane understanding, born from a world where the weave of magic is unraveling. These pioneers of martial and mystical arts integrated newfound arcane knowledge into their combat techniques, crafting a refined martial art that harmonizes elemental forces with physical prowess. Over the years, their practices spread beyond Cassius, evolving into a distinguished discipline. Today, Mysticshift Duelists are renowned warriors who embody the art of transformation, leveraging elemental stances to dynamically adapt in combat. Their path demands a profound comprehension of both the elements and one's inner self, attracting those intrigued by the challenge of mastering such versatile and potent powers.

subclassFeature.name: Arms of the Mysticshift
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}

Upon embarking on the path of the Mysticshift Duelist, you commit to mastering the art of combat through both traditional weaponry and the precise application of firearms. This unique synthesis of martial disciplines forms the foundation of your journey, preparing you for the eventual creation of your signature weapon—the Elemental Gunblade.

At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with one {@filter melee weapon|items|category=basic|type=melee weapon} and one {@filter firearm|items|category=basic|type=firearm;modern;renaissance} of your choice. These weapons become the focal point of your training, each representing one half of the duality you seek to master. Through rigorous practice, you learn to channel elemental energies into every strike and shot, laying the groundwork for the fusion of these disciplines.

Your dedication to mastering both the blade and the bullet grants you unique combat advantages. When wielding your chosen melee weapon or firearm, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and the attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcomming resistance.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Stance Initiation
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}

Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to adopt elemental stances, each offering unique enhancements to your attacks. When you make a weapon attack, you may choose one of your stances to activate it, adding the effects from the stance if it hits. Repeated attacks made with the same stance grants additional effects stacking based on the number of successful attacks made. Switching stances resets the stacks to 0.
The saving throw DC for stance effects is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (whichever is higher).
Select two stances initially, you may choose an additional stance when you reach the 7th, 10th and 15th level in this class.

entries.caption: Stances
rows: Attacks ignite targets, dealing {@dice 1d8} ongoing fire damage for 1 turn.
Create a blaze around the target, dealing {@dice 2d8} fire damage to enemies within 10 feet.
Unleash a fiery explosion on hit, dealing {@dice 4d8} fire damage to all enemies within 30 feet. Requires a Dexterity saving throw.
Gain +1 AC and deal {@dice 1d4} cold damage to melee attackers.
Attacks slow the target, reducing their speed by 10 feet until your next turn.
Freeze the ground, making it difficult terrain in a 15-foot radius around the target.
Encase targets in ice on hit, {@condition stunned} for 1 turn. Requires a Constitution saving throw.
Increase movement speed by 10 feet and add {@dice 1d4} lightning damage to attacks.
Gain advantage on all Dexterity saving throws and skill checks.
Create a tempest on hit, dealing {@dice 2d8} lightning damage to the target and up to two additional enemies within 20 feet.
Gain +2 to all saving throws and resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
Attacks fortify you, granting temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Constitution modifier.
Attacks can cause the earth to grasp enemies, reducing their speed to 0 until the end of their next turn.
Trigger a localized earthquake, knocking enemies within 20 feet prone. Requires a Strength saving throw.
Attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage, healing you for half the amount dealt.
Diminish enemy strength, reducing their damage output by {@dice 1d4} for 1 turn.
Silence enemies hit, preventing them from casting spells for 1 turn. Requires a Wisdom saving throw.
Consume life force, dealing {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage and gaining temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. Affects all enemies within 15 feet.
Add {@dice 1d6} radiant damage to attacks and dispel magical darkness in a 10-foot radius.
Illuminate targets, granting advantage on attacks against them and dealing {@dice 1d6} additional radiant damage.
Enemies hit are {@condition blinded} for 1 turn. Requires a Constitution saving throw.
A radiant burst expands from you, blinding all enemies within 20 feet and dealing {@dice 3d8} radiant damage. Requires a Constitution saving throw.
Attacks extend your reach by 5 feet and add {@dice 1d4} force damage.
Generate an updraft with each hit, granting you the ability to ignore difficult terrain.
Gain a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 turn.
Create a vortex on hit, pulling up to three enemies within 30 feet towards the target. Requires a Strength saving throw.
Attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} poison damage and slow enemies by 10 feet.
Entangle enemies hit, reducing their speed to 0 until they succeed on a Strength saving throw.
Vines grapple the target, {@condition restraining} them for 1 turn. Requires a Strength saving throw.
A massive vine burst restrains all enemies within 20 feet, dealing {@dice 3d6} poison damage. Requires a Strength saving throw.

entries: Upon reaching 6 successful attacks in the same stance, unleash the specified effect. Stacks reset to 1 thereafter.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of Blade and Bullet
entries: {@i 7rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}

At 7th level, you gain the ability to combine your chosen melee weapon and firearm into a singular, powerful weapon: the Elemental Gunblade. This fusion requires a ritual that spans a day and a night, during which you must channel elemental energies into the weapons, binding them with your own spirit. The resulting Elemental Gunblade is a masterwork of craftsmanship and arcane power, unique to you and unusable by anyone else.

Upon completing the ritual, you gain proficiency with your Elemental Gunblade, which retains the properties of both the original melee weapon and firearm. The elemental gunblade also counts as one of your chosen weapons and benefits from the +1 bonus to attack rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Reverb
entries: At 7th level, you gain the ability to instantly channel the full force of an Elemental Stance through your Gunblade. Once per short rest, as part of an attack, you can apply one of your known stance's max stack effect on your target.

Additionally, when you switch stances from max stacks, the energy release emits a 15-foot radius elemental shockwave, dealing {@dice 2d8} force damage and pushing creatures of your choice back 5 feet on a failed Dexterity save.

subclassFeature.name: Stance Weaving
entries: {@i 7rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}
By 7th level, you have mastered the ability to shift between your known elemental stances in such rapid fluidity that they have begun to weave more effectively.

As a bonus action on your turn, you enter a perfect weave state for 1 minute. If you have a stance active, you gain 5 stacks in it immediately. While in this state, when you switch to a new stance the effects from the previous one linger until the next switch. You must also switch stances every turn to keep perfect weave active. You lose perfect weave at the end of your turn if you have not switched stances atleast once.
You may enter this state as many times as your proficiency bonus and uses recharge on a short rest

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Resilience
entries: {@i 10th-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}
Your mastery over the elemental forces not only empowers your attacks but also fortifies your resolve and vitality. This mastery manifests in two key ways:

items: Defensive Harmony: You gain a bonus to all saving throws equal to half the number of stacks (rounded down) you have in any stance. This bonus reflects your heightened elemental awareness, enhancing your ability to evade or withstand harmful effects.

Elemental Transference: When you switch stances, the accumulated elemental energy rejuvenates you, healing you for an amount equal to the number of stacks in the previous stance before the switch. This healing represents the restorative power of the elements flowing through you, a reward for your strategic mastery over the elemental stances.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Gunblade Ascendance
entries: {@i 15th-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}
Your mastery of the elemental stances allows you to unleash a devastating Ascendant Attack, channeling the full might of your chosen element through your Elemental Gunblade.

Upon reaching the maximum stacks in an elemental stance twice in a row, you gain the ability to perform an Ascendant Attack associated with that stance for the next one minute. You may use this special ascendant attack in place of one of your extra attacks. These powerful attacks can be used once per long rest for each stance.
The Ascendant Attacks are as follows:

items: Inferno Vortex (Blaze Reprisal Stance): Create a 30-foot radius vortex of fire at a point you can see within 120 feet. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area becomes difficult terrain, and creatures that fail the save are also {@condition blinded} by the intense flames for 1 minute. An affected creature at the end of each of its turns may repeat the saving throw to try and end the blindness.

Frost Sigil (Glacial Guard): Summon a sigil on the ground within a 60-foot radius. Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@dice 4d6} cold damage on a failed save and becoming {@condition slowed} for 1 minute on a failed save. The ground becomes difficult terrain. An affected creature at the end of each of its turns may repeat the saving throw to try and end the slowness.

Lightning Tempest (Tempest Fury): Target up to three creatures you can see within 150 feet. Each must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 5d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Affected creatures are also {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

Earthshaker Pulse (Stone Bulwark): Cause an earthquake in a 50-foot radius around you. Enemies must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition knocked prone} and take {@dice 4d6} bludgeoning damage. The affected area becomes difficult terrain.

Abyssal Drain (Void Embrace): Release a 20-foot radius wave of dark energy. Enemies within range must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@dice 5d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You gain temporary hit points equal to the highest damage dealt to one target.

Radiant Dawn (Solar Flare): Emit a 60-foot radius burst of radiant light. Enemies within the burst must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute and take {@dice 5d6} radiant damage. Allies in the area gain temporary hit points equal to your fighter level. An affected creature at the end of each of its turns may repeat the saving throw to try and end the blindness.

Galeforce Dash (Aether Wind): Transform into a gust of wind, moving up to 100 feet in a line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 4d6} force damage on a failed save, and is {@condition pushed} 15 feet to the side of the line on a failed save.

Verdant Cataclysm (Nature's Bind): Cause a 40-foot radius of thorny vines to erupt. Creatures in the area must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} and take {@dice 4d6} piercing damage at the start of each of their turns. On a success, the creature is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest unoccupied space outside the vines. The area becomes difficult terrain.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Resonance
entries: At 18th level, select an elemental stance at dawn; its base effect is always on. When you hit max stacks on your selected stance, you can activate Elemental Resonance for 1 minute, maximizing your chosen stance's effects without needing stacks on each attack. This power surge ends if you're incapacitated or prone.
Once Elemental resonance ends, you may use it again after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Way of Awakened Mind
entries: Old Livian tales speak of strangely garbed men who broke upon the shores of Yesvaris on strange boats from a sea that surrounds no land. They bore no blade nor bow, spoke no tongue that one could understand, bearing no message nor gift for any lord, instead they were content to merely wander the earth.

Little was spoken yet some could detect some deep disappointment. They sold their ships and settled into a refuge atop Mt. Songshan. There they would live mostly in isolation, far from the squabbling tribes below for a few centuries.

Only during the invasions of Gulbrodr, the Reaver King did they swear fealty to Seauntrenu the Strange under the agreement that he or anyone else may seek tutelage from the monastery if their devotion was deemed enough.

A few of the acolytes there would learn of a way to seemingly poke and prod their sight through to a second world held within the future. Though some believe it demeaning to utilize such a blessing for combat, rogue schools doing just that would eventually rise, with the original purpose lost to time.
Heretical though it may been to some, it proved to be a very effective method of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Premonition
entries: As a bonus action, you slip into one of two lucid states where you perceive glimpses into the near future:-

entries.name: Vulpine
entries: As part of the bonus action and at the start of each of your turns while you are in the state, make a Premonition check (a DC 15 Wisdom check). On a success, roll a Premonition die which is a d20 and keep it with it's result. Whenever a feature calls for spending a Premonition die, you must possess and spend at least one ki point to use it.
Whenever you or a creature you see within 10 ft. makes an attack roll or a saving throw you may replace the roll with the Premonition die's roll, spending it.

Any Premonition die gained, lasts only till the start of your next turn, unless you spend a ki point then. If you do, you forgo making the Premonition check for that turn and keep the Premonition die from the previous turn.
This state lasts for a minute, after which any Premonition die possessed are discarded.

entries.name: Cervine
entries: For this turn and for the next 10 minutes, you gain advantage on all ability checks.
Once you enter any of these states, you must take a long rest to regain use of it.

entries.name: Roll20 Macro
entries: A nifty macro for Premonition checks in Roll20. In your Roll20 character sheet look for the 'Attributes & Abilities' tab. Then create an ability called something like 'Premonition check' and in the larger text field paste this bit of code
&{template:default}{{name=Premonition Check}}{{ [[ {1d20+@{|wisdom_mod}}>[[15]] ]] }}
Then replace '' with the case sensitive name on the sheet (remove the < & >). click the tick mark, then check 'Show in Macro Bar'.

subclassFeature.name: Pass the time
entries: As part of your rigorous training, you would learn to pick up many games of luck or skill. In each bout, acolytes would attempt to utilize their unnatural foresight against each other in what was essentially a contest to peer further into the future than their opponent.
Choose a {@item Gaming Set}. You become proficient with it and any checks made with Gaming Sets are made with advanatage.

subclassFeature.name: Peel back the Veil
entries: You achieve the first step towards understanding the nature of this world, utilizing your learnings as abilities.
Wou may spend two ki points to cast {@spell Augury}, {@spell Locate Object}, {@spell Find Traps} or {@spell Fortune's Favor|EGW} (without the spells material components).
Additionally, When you have no uses of Premonition, you can use a number of ki points equal to your proficiency bonus at the end of a short rest to regain use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Living ahead of the moment
entries: At the 11th level, You have spent such time peering across the temporal realm that you have mastered it's interference with your reality. You gain the following benefits:-

items: When you make a Premonition check or when rolling for your Premonition die, you may use a bonus action and ki point to reroll the d20.
You may now attempt to replace the rolls of creatures you can see with Premonition die's within 20 ft. of you, instead of 10 ft..
When you roll a d20 on your Premonition die, you may immediately spend it to get advantage on all attacks and saving throws for this turn.

subclassFeature.name: A Body one with the Future
entries: At the 17th level, The barriers to the temporal realm now remain a mere curtain for your mind and can even twist the threads of fate to some extent. You gain the follwoing features

subclassFeature.name: Predictive Impulse
entries: Whenever you use the attack action you may spend a Premonition die to make an additional attack using the result on it as the roll. Additionally, when you dodge an attack using a Premonition die, the next attack made against you is made with disadvantage till the state ends.

subclassFeature.name: Forge Fate
entries: Once per long rest, when you roll your Premonition die, you may instead choose a number from 5-15 and keep the Premonition die with that number.

subclassFeature.name: The Croupier
entries: Tales and rumours occasionally spill from the taverns of men who appear to be perhaps too charming, a tad more deft or quite a bit smooth in the way they operate. Perhaps they've played the violin too well for his time or they've caught the hearts of one too many an admirer or, most commonly, they find themselves with too many winning hands. So tales and rumors become myth of men succumbing to the dealings of an opportunistic power and for once, they're right.

Entities of many vareity take the form of The Croupier when they come to strike a wager with their beneficiaries, usually appealing to their greed or their desire for more charm or even simply a want for the skill they offer. These beings can be tricksters, agents of chaos, enjoyers of the arts, observers of luck or even sheerly malignant. They take the form of a simple dealer luring their victims with bets eventually culminating in a stacked contract. Since after all:-
The house always wins.

subclassFeature.name: "Is this your card?"
entries: At 1st level when you choose this pact, your patron bestows his conduit for your Warlock spells; The Eldtritch Deck. You can spend 1 hour in ritual to summon the deck in your hand or convert an appropriate arcane focus to one. you may only have one at a time and attempting to create another will result the previous deck disappearing, leaving an arcane focus behind if it was used.

The deck counts as an arcane focus and appears as a pack of cards to a game of your choosing. It appears non-magical to divination magic and when drawn from the pack, produces the exact cards for whichever game is being played upto a total of 400 cards. Any cards outside the pack disappear after 24 hours. You may also choose to know the exact position and faces of cards in the deck.

You become proficient with {@filter gaming sets|items|source=phb|miscellaneous=mundane|type=gaming set} and learn the {@spell prestidigitation} spell. When you use it, you can conceal the verbal and somatic components of the spell as ordinary conversation and card handling.

entries.name: Eldritch Cards(Optional)
entries: When you cast {@spell eldritch blast} with the Eldritch Deck, instead of beams you can choose to give them the appearance of cards produced from your deck.

subclassFeature.name: Croupier's Pact Spells
entries: The Croupier lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Cardistry
entries: Your patron grants you the house edge; A set of abilities for you to choose from known as 'Tricks'. You know of one of your choice from the table below when you get this feature and can know as many as the number of warlock spell slots you possess, learning a new one when you gain another slot.

When you use a Trick, you must spend a warlock spell slot for the spellcasting involved with the Trick and you may not use the same Trick again until you finish a short or a long rest. You cannot use multiple tricks on the same spell. You may replace a Trick you know for another when you gain a level in this class.

items: {@b Pick-up:} You may use this trick when you cast a spell to disappear in a cloud of cards and turn {@condition invisible} until the beginning of your next turn.

{@b Reveal:} When a creature targets you with a attack roll or a spell, you may use this Trick and cast a spell with the casting time of an action and targeting only that creature if within range of the spell.

{@b Throw:} When you use the {@action cast a spell} action, you may use this Trick by throwing a card at a point within 30 feet of you. The spell is then cast as though you were standing at that point.

{@b Deal:} You can use this Trick by using an action to store a spell of a casting time of an Action, bonus action or reaction spending a warlock spell slot in the process. A person wielding this card may then use the corresponing action to cast the spell with your save DC, spell attack bonus and spellcasting ability, spending the card in the proccess. 8 hours after making this card, it disappears.
{@b Flip:} You can use this Trick by casting a spell with the casting time of an action as a bonus action.

{@b Flourish:} When you cast a spell you can use this Trick to bedazzle creatures around you with your stage magic. 3 creatures of your choice 60 feet away from you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or all become {@condition charmed} by you or all {@condition blinded} (your choice) until the start of your next turn.

{@b Split:} When you cast a spell that targets a single creature, you can use this Trick to target a second. If the spell includes an attack roll or a saving throw, both are subject to it. After seeing the results, you may pick one of them and they take the full effect of the spell.
{@b Hole:} You can use this Trick to cast a spell wihtout its somatic and verbal components.

{@b Shuffle:} At the start of your turn you may choose to use this Trick by rolling {@dice 2d8|2 d8s}, rerolling any repeats then picking one. Until the start of your next turn, you are able to use the corresponding Trick in the table once.

subclassFeature.name: Sharp Instincts
entries: At the 6th level, your Senses and Skills as a gambler becomed honed. Pick one of the streams from below when you get this feature. You receive its benefits.

items: {@b Showmanship:} You gain proficiency in Charisma(Performance) checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Deceit:} You gain proficiency in Charisma(Performance) checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Finesse:} You gain proficiency in Dexterity(Sleight-of-Hand) checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Flair:} Your proficiency bonus is doubled when making checks with Gaming Sets.
{@b Wariness:} You gain proficiency in Wisdom(Insight) checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Mistrust:} You get a hidden +5 bonus to checks to determine an illusion that your DM applies.

entries: If you are already proficient in a skill that you picked a stream for, you may pick another from the Warlock class skills.

subclassFeature.name: Lady Luck's Kiss
entries: You know the {@spell fortune's favor|egw} spell and can cast it once at its lowest level without a material component. When cast this way, the duration lasts for 8 hours instead. You have it always prepared and it doesn't count towards your spells known limit.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Card
entries: At the 10th level, your patron hides a few tricks up your sleeve.
Once per long rest, you may cast a warlock spell of a slot that is available that you haven't prepared.

You also gain a wild card in the form of an additional special warlock spell slot. When casting with the wild card, you may use any applicable Trick you know in conjuction with it without spending a use of the Trick. You regain use of it after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The House Always Wins
entries: At the 14th level, your patron grants you his greatest boon, an unstable connection to the weave. You gain possession of 2 special dice in the form of a d4 and a d6, gaining a d8 as well at the 15th level in this class.

Whenever you spend a warlock spell slot, you may roll a d4. If casting from the 6th or 7th level Mystic Arcanum, roll a d6 or a d8 if casting from the 8th or 9th level Mystic Arcanum. If any of these dice rolls roll their maximum, you regain the spell slot or use of the Mystic Arcanum.
After rolling any of these dice, you may once spend a spell slot to roll it again. Once regained, that die cannot be used until a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Style of Poise
entries: Within the spelldance it is prefered by most choreurgists to be wielding nothing as any unnecessary weight hinders the ability to motion fast and precisely. Practitioners of the School of Poise learn to integrate weapons into their spelldance.
They Allow their body to meld with the weapon by adapting to their weapon's heft and wieldiness. If they manage to integrate it into their body, perhaps they may even cast spells through them.

subclassFeature.name: Poise Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Poise Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Balance Training
entries: You gain proficiency with a weapon that possesses the finesse property of your choice.

You must spend time before a long rest training with a weapon with the finesse property that you are proficient in, to get used to its weight and form after which it becomes your Poise weapon. Any such weapon of similar make can then be used as your poise weapon.
Your poise weapon becomes an arcane focus for you. When you cast spells, you can cast them through this weapon.
You may know only one poise weapon as it takes time adjusting to another. While wielding Poise weapons and no other weapons nor shields, you gain all of this subclasses features.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Fencer's Dance
entries: Augment. You can spend one vigour slot when entering spelldance to grant yourself additional reach of 5 ft. and extend the range of Cantrips with a range of Self(5 feet) to the reach of your weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Insightful Strike
entries: Once per turn, When you successfully land a melee attack on a creature, you create an opening for yourself. The creature will suffer a disadvantage on a saving throw for the next Cantrip you cast at that creature till the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Clairvoyant Strike
entries: Enchances True Strike. When you cast true strike, it's benefits are instead applied to the next weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Style of Forte
entries: Cantrips on their own are too simple a spell to reach any height of power. Followers of the school of Forte recognize a method of casting them deemed unorthodox and unstable. They tap into an inner chaos present within their spelldance and the spells they cast, Sacrificing safety and certainty to unlock it's potential to wreak untold amounts of destruction.

subclassFeature.name: Forte Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Forte Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Interference
entries: If you cast a damaging Cantrip which targets a single creature and it fails its saving throw, The damage roll it receives may increase the damage. If any number is repeated in the damage roll, you must add it again to the total damage.
This feature must be used after rerolling any damage dice

subclassFeature.name: Overloaded
entries: Your Choreurgic Capacity increases by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Dance of Synchronicity
entries: Augment. You can spend one vigour slot when you enter this dance to be able to reroll one damage of each Cantrip cast within the spelldance.

subclassFeature.name: Constructive Interference
entries: Enhances interference. When two of the damage dice roll the same even number, you can target a second creature with the same Cantrip within its range.

subclassFeature.name: Destructive Interference
entries: Enhances interference. For every repeated odd number that appears, the radius of a spherical area of effect grows by 10 ft. centered at the target. Every creature in that area receives half the total damage of the corresponding damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Modulation
entries: When you use the Dance of Synchronicity augment, you can now reroll 2 damage dice per Cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Style of Fervour
entries: In the arduous course of memorizing and repetition, you've taken a keen interest in the elemental nature of the spells you cast and the effects of your innate zeal in fueling them. In this journey, you gain greater insight into the elements, their reactions to the creatures they affect and perhaps more importantly, ways to protect against them.

subclassFeature.name: Fervour Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Fervour Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Analysis
entries: Once per turn, when a creature you can see is affected by a Cantrip you cast, you can check To see if the creature was resistant, immune or vulnerable to the damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Prismatic Guard
entries: If you cast a Cantrip that deals damage, you can choose to become resistant to its damage type till the start of your next turn. You can invoke this resistance a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier before each long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dance of Shattered Light
entries: Augment. You can spend one vigour slot to change the damage type of any Cantrips cast within the spelldance.

subclassFeature.name: Chromatic Cascade
entries: For each Cantrip you cast previously within the spelldance that dealt a different damage type, you deal an additional point of damage of the corresponding type when casting a Cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Prismatic Ward
entries: As a bonus action you can pick two willing creatures within 30ft of you. They will receive the benefit of your Prismatic Guard while they are in range.

subclassFeature.name: Style of Rigour
entries: There's more to casting than shaking a hand and uttering some words. Perhaps those that follow the school of Rigour understand this more than most. They view Choreurgy and minor magics as a science to be thoroughly studied and grasped. Cantrips and the arcane motion are equations on a parchment that need to be broken down and rebuilt constantly to achieve the most efficiency. With enough experimentation they hope to engineer movements so complex that it would be as if you were dancing with two bodies.

subclassFeature.name: Rigour Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Rigour Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Cantrip Efficiency
entries: You've created a method to make the spelldance itself more efficient. You can add your intelligence modifier to the total Damage roll of your Cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Torrential Dance
entries: Augment. You can spend two vigour slots to modify your Cantrips, enabling them to disrupt your opponents ability to resist the effects of your Cantrips. When a creature fails a saving throw of a Cantrip cast in this spelldance, it becomes debilitated till the end of your next turn. While this way, it has disadvantage against the debilitating saving throw for Cantrips you cast.

subclassFeature.name: Vigorous Transmutation
entries: Your study into the nature of surge conversion has yielded a more efficient method of transmuting vigour slots. When you use the power surge feature to convert spell slots, you get one additional vigour slot.

subclassFeature.name: Metachoreurgy
entries: You've learnt to tap into a 'Second Body'. Controlling it allows you to push the intricacy of your spelldance to new frontiers. When you enter Spelldance, you can apply two augments at the same time.
Additionally, if you choose to only use one augment, Cantrips you cast within the spelldance do not require a somatic component.

subclassFeature.name: Style of Grace
entries: Practitioners of the style of grace are able to channel their dance into a sight of placidity, easing the stressed and benumbing the hurt. Due to their limited arcane capability they do not make for effective healers but through their soothing dance they are capable of numbing pain and easing suffering, allowing those under their care to fight just that little bit longer or at the very least, carry the wounded to safety.

subclassFeature.name: Grace Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Grace Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Lesser Healer
entries: You gain proficiency with the herbalism kit. If you are already proficient in it you may choose a tool proficiency from the possible Flickwrist's tool proficiencies.

subclassFeature.name: First Response
entries: Modifies Spare the Dying. When you cast Spare the Dying on a dying creature you may revive it with 1 hit point. However for each time it has been revived this way since it's last long rest, it will automatically fail that many death saves when they begin dying again.

subclassFeature.name: Preserver's Dance
entries: Augment. You may spend one vigour slot when entering spell dance to give your Cantrips a soothing byproduct. When you cast a Cantrip during this dance, roll a number of d6s equal to the vigour slots used. You may grant a creature of your choice within the Cantrip's range the resulting total as temporary hitpoints. You may use this dance a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. When you reach the 10th and 14th level the d6s become d8s and d10s respectively.

subclassFeature.name: Placating Presence
entries: When making a Charisma(Persuasion) or a Charisma(Deception) check you can add your Wisdom Modifier to it.

subclassFeature.name: Lulling Balm
entries: If you have 4 vigour slots, as an action, you may initiate a hypnotic performance. 6 Creatures of your choice that can see you and that you can see must make Wisdom Saving Throws against your Cantrip Save DC. On a failure, they are then Blinded or Charmed. If Charmed, they move at half speed and cannot take any actions that harm other creatures. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turns.

subclassFeature.name: Swansong
entries: When using the First Response feature, You are able to tap into an energy reserve innate within the creature. The creature being revived can expend upto half of his remaining hit dice (rounded up) to heal itself.

subclassFeature.name: Saboteur
entries: When the Livian 12th Engineer corps trained their first Saboteurs, they expected them to infiltrate enemy lines in disguise and wreak havoc in their most crucial moments. Not only did they succeed in that front, their purpose has expanded in many directions since then. Finding use even in the front lines where they would wield a mechanism acting as a third arm to operate their complex devices.

Though proving to be highly effective, they would come back to bite the Livian empire. With the onset of the peace of the 11th Era, branches of the military would slowly dissolve into mercenary corps. The many princes, dukes  and merchant lords would come to find the saboteurs’ expertise invaluable in setting their competition back a few years.

entries.name: Saboteur
entries: The war is not yet over. All that has changed are the front lines.

subclassFeature.name: Saboteur Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Saboteur Spells table. These spells count as Artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Saboteur Spells
rows: {@spell mirror image|phb|mirror image}, {@spell maximillian's earthen grasp|xge|maximillian's earthen grasp}

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with Mason’s Tools and Alchemist’s Tools. If you already have either of these proficiencies, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Third Arm
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to magically transform your Mason’s Tools into a contraption that functions as a third arm. Once a day, you can spend an hour to produce your third arm from your Mason’s Tools. Only when this third arm is wielded by you can you utilise the rest of this feature. While wielding it, it can be utilized as a set of Mason’s Tools.

The Hand is a tiny magical object that shares its initiative with you. Additionally you use your actions and its actions in any order. While it is being wielded it can be in your space but cannot move more than 5 feet away from you and has a movement speed of half of the wearer(rounded down).
If the arm is not wielding anything you can use a bonus action to perform the following with it:-

entries.name: Slip Away
entries: The arm aids provides a distraction, allowing you to disengage

entries.name: Protect
entries: The arm readies into a defensive stance reducing damage at some cost to its structural integrity. If you are hit  and take piercing,bludgeoning or slashing damage,you may reduce the damage by 1d8 and instead apply it to the hand.

entries.name: Repair
entries: (2/Day). The hands innate magic restores 2d8 + PB hit points to itself or to one construct or object within 5 feet of it.

entries.name: Dodge
entries: The arm anticipates any attack made against it. It gains the benefits of a Dodge action.

entries.name: Help
entries: You or another creature within the arm's reach gains the benefit of a help action. When done this way, it does not grant advantage on skill checks.
If a bonus action wasn’t used to activate it and isn’t wielding anything, it will automatically perform the dodge action.

The arm has an AC of 13 + your Proficiency Bonus and a number of hit points equal to four times your artificer level. It is immune to poison damage and psychic damage, and all conditions. If it is forced to make an ability check or a saving throw, treat all its ability scores as 10 (+0). If the mending spell is cast on it, it regains 2d6 hit points. It disappears after 1 hour or if it is reduced to 0 hit points.

You may determine the arms appearance when you create it. It consists of a base that is worn on your body and the appendage which may range in appearance as an arm with many joints, to a tentacle resembling a spine, to a floating claw.

subclassFeature.name: Apprentice Arsonist
entries: At 3rd level, Your knowledge in volatile alchemy has granted you the ability to create Bombs. Using your Alchemist’s Tools you may create a number of them equal to your proficiency bonus during a short or long rest. Creating more than that will result in the oldest bomb turning inert and disintegrating. Bombs that are not on your person begin to decay and will too turn inert and disintegrate after a days time has passed.
While you possess these bombs, you may use an action to throw them upto 20 feet away after which they will explode on impact, affecting creatures in a spherical area.
When you create the bombs you can determine its type from the the following

entries.name: Fireworks
entries: Subjects Creatures in a 15 foot radius to a Dexterity Saving Throw. Deals 3d10 Fire Damage on a failure.

entries.name: Sunburst
entries: Subjects Creatures in a 10 foot radius to a Constitution Saving Throw. Deals 3d8 Radiant Damage and Blinds them on a failure.

entries.name: Impellors
entries: Subjects Creatures in a 20 foot radius to a Strength Saving Throw. Deals 3d8 Thunder Damage and throws them back 10 foot on a failure.

entries.name: Box of Nox
entries: Subjects Creatures in a 10 feet radius to a Constitution Saving Throw. Deals 4d4 Poison Damage and they become poisoned.

entries.name: Canned Fog
entries: Produces the Fog Cloud Spell Effect at the point of impact.

entries.name: Wurmbite
entries: Subjects Creatures in a 20 feet radius to a Dexterity Saving Throw. Deals 4d6 Acid Damage and another 2d6 on the start of its turn on a failure. And half as much on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Instead of one of the attacks, you can throw a bomb.

items: You can cast spells from your Third Arm and while it is not wielding anything, you gain a climbing speed of 15 feet.

When a bomb damages an object that isn’t being worn or carried, depending on the material of the object and the bomb used, it deals critical damage. For dirt and/or stone, an Impeller, For Metal a Wurmbite, For wood a Fireworks.

subclassFeature.name: Explosives Expert
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can increase the potency of your explosives.

items: Your Bombs deal an additional dice of damage of its damage type if it can deal damage.

You gain the ability to plant bombs and explode them remotely. When you use a bomb to interact with an object, you may affix the bomb to it given that it is not being worn or carried.You may then set a timer for when it explodes(Remember that a bomb may become inert after a days time from creation has passed). Or you may activate one of your choice with a bonus action. A bomb that is damaged by another bomb will automatically explode.

subclassFeature.name: Pyrotechnic Pandemonium
entries: Starting at 15th level, Once you breach the enemy’s lines, you turn into the very spirit of chaos.

items: On your first round of combat, you can utilize your arms functions using a free action

Once per short/long rest, You can use a bonus action to throw 3 grenades with your third arm. Creatures affected must also make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist
entries: An Alchemist is an expert at combining reagents to produce mystical effects. Alchemists use their creations to give life and to leech it away. Alchemy is the oldest of artificer traditions, and its versatility has long been valued during times of war and peace.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist Spells
entries: {@i 3rd-level Alchemist feature}

You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Alchemist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Experimental Potion
entries: {@i 3rd-level Alchemist feature}

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can magically produce a number of  Potions equal to your proficiency bonus in an empty flask you touch. At higher levels, you gain additional options and features that also use this resource. Roll on the corresponding potion table for each of the potion's effect, which is triggered when someone drinks/uses the potion. As a bonus action, a creature can drink the elixir or administer it to a willing creature within 5 feet of it.
Creating a potion requires you to have {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} on your person, and any potion you create with this feature lasts until it is drunk or until the end of your next long rest.

You can create additional Potions by expending a spell slot of the appropriate level or higher for each one. When you do so, you use your action to create the elixir in an empty flask you touch, and you choose the elixir's effect from the corresponding potion table.
If you drink a potion or elixir that you created, its potency is increased as, shown in brackets.

entries.caption: Experimental Potions (1st level spell slot)
rows: {@b Healing}. The drinker regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + your Intelligence modifier (add your artificer level to the healing).
{@b Swiftness}. The drinker's walking speed increases by 10 feet for 1 hour (your speed is increased by 30 feet).
{@b Resilience}. The drinker gains a +1 bonus to AC for 10 minutes (the bonus is increased to +2).
{@b Boldness}. The drinker can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to every attack roll and saving throw they make for the next minute (The bonus is increased to  {@dice 2d4}).
{@b Flight}. The drinker gains a flying speed of 10 feet for 10 minutes (The speed is increased to 30 feet).

{@b Transformation}. The drinker's body is transformed as if by the {@spell alter self} spell. The drinker determines the transformation caused by the spell, the effects of which last for 10 minutes (You can choose to gain any number of the benefits of the alter self spell).

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: {@i 3rd-level Alchemist feature}
You gain proficiency with {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Savant
entries: At 5th level, you develop masterful command of magical chemicals, enhancing the healing and damage you create through them.

subclassFeature.name: Refined Formulae
entries: {@i 5th-level Alchemist feature}

Whenever you cast a spell using your {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} as the spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to one roll of the spell. That roll must restore hit points or be a damage roll that deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage, and the bonus equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

Additionally, you gain the following options added to your Experimental Potion feature. If a creature attempts to drink multiple refined potions which have a duration, it will only gain the benefit of the latest one. You can now also administer your potion to any creature within 30 feet of you.

entries.caption: Refined Potions (2nd level spell slot)
rows: {@b Heroism}. The drinker regains a number of temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier at the start of each of their turns. Additionally, it gains immunity to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions. This benefit lasts for 1 minute (Any wasted temporary hitpoints are turned into healing).

{@b Speed}. The drinker's movement speed is doubled, and it gains an additional action. This action can only be used to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide} or {@action Use an Object} actions only. This benefit lasts for 1 minute, and gives you the {@condition incapacitated} condition for 1 turn after it ends (You can use the additional action to cast a cantrip or a spell of 1st level). This bonus does not stack with the {@spell haste} spell.

{@b Sturdiness}. The drinker gains a +2 bonus to AC and advantage against Dexterity and Constitution saving throws for 10 minutes (You also gain advantage against all saving throws made against spells).
{@b Resistance}. When you create this potion, choose a damage type. The drinker gains resistance to the chosen damage type for 1 hour (You can choose two damage types when you create the potion).

{@b Cleansing}. The drinker can reduce their exhaustion level by 1 or end any disease or condition affecting them. The condition must be one of {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition poisoned} or {@condition paralyzed} (you can also end the {@condition stunned} or the {@condition incapacitated} condition if you are affected by them).
{@b Power}. The drinker's Strength score is increased to 21 for 1 hour (Your strength score is increased to 23).

subclassFeature.name: Armament Coatings
entries: You can create coatings that magically enhance the effectiveness of weapons.
A weapon can only gain the benefit of one coating at a time. The coatings last for 1 minute, and takes a bonus action to apply to a weapon.

entries.caption: Coatings (2nd level spell slot)
rows: {@b Sharpness}. The weapon gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. (The attack and damage bonuses are increased to +2)
{@b Accuracy}. The weapon gains a +2 bonus to its attack rolls. (the attack bonus is increased to your intelligence modifier, minimum of +2).

{@b Slaying}. Choose a creature type when you create this coating. The weapon gains an additional {@dice 1d6} damage against the creature. Additionally, any damage dealt by the coated weapons attack ignores damage resistances against the chosen creature type (the damage bonus is increased to {@dice 2d6}).

{@b Gleaming}. The weapon emits an aura of bright light for 10 feet, and dim light for an additional 10 feet. As a reaction after being hit by an attack, the wielder can use their reaction to blind the attacker unless they make a constitution save against your spell save dc (any creature that comes within 5 feet of you for the first time on a turn must make the constitution save or be blinded until the end of their turn).

{@b Bane}. The weapon inflicts a {@dice 1d4} penalty to the ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws of any creature it hits unless they succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save dc (The penalty is increased to a 1d6).
{@b Viciousness}. The roll required to land a critical hit while wielding this weapon is reduced by one (the roll is reduced by two).

subclassFeature.name: Restorative Reagents
entries: {@i 9th-level Alchemist feature}
You can incorporate restorative reagents into some of your works:

subclassFeature.name: Soothing Balm
entries: You can cast {@spell lesser restoration} without expending a spell slot and without preparing the spell, provided you use {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} as the spellcasting focus. You can do so a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Experimental Elixir
entries: You have learnt to produce more durable and effective kinds of potions, which last until the end of a long rest.
Once a creature consumes an elixir, they cannot benefit from another elixir until they finish a long rest.

entries.caption: Experimental Elixirs (level 3 spell slot)
rows: {@b Bloodlust}. The drinker gains a number of temporary hitpoints equal to your intelligence modifier. Whenever the drinker drops a creature to 0 hitpoints, it gains additional temporary hitpoints equal to your intelligence modifier, as well as an action on that turn (you gain the temporary hitpoints and additional actions when you land a critical hit or drop a creature to 0 hitpoints). You can only gain one additional action per turn.
{@b Arcane Cultivation}. The drinker gains an additional 5th spell slot (You gain a 6th level spell slot).
{@b Focus}. The drinker cannot lose concentration on a spell as a result of taking damage. (You cannot lose concentration, unless you are dropped to 0 hitpoints)

{@b Colossus}. The drinker's size increases by 1 level. Additionally, its weapons deal an additional {@dice 1d6} damage, and it gains advantage on strength checks and saves (Your size increases by two levels, and the damage bonus is increased to {@dice 2d6}).

{@b Drake}. After drinking the potion, the creature can use its bonus action on any subsequent turn to exhale a 30-foot cone or a 60 foot line of damaging breath. Choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder or poison damage (your choice). Each creature in its area must make a dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@dice 4d8} damage on a failed save, or half as much on a succesful one (The damage increases to {@dice 6d8} for you). Once the breath is used, you cannot use it again unless it is recharged. The breath recharges when you Roll a 6 on a {@dice d6} at the start of your turn.

{@b Nimbleness}. If the drinker is subject to a saving throw that allows you to make a Dexterity or Constitution saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail (You gain this benefit for any saving throw).

subclassFeature.name: Chemical Mastery
entries: {@i 15th-level Alchemist feature}
You have been exposed to so many chemicals that they pose little risk to you, and you can use them to quickly end certain ailments:

items: You gain resistance to acid damage and poison damage, and you are immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition.

You can cast {@spell greater restoration} and {@spell heal} without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without material components, provided you use {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} as the spellcasting focus. Once you cast either spell with this feature, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest.
You have mastered the craft of potion-making. Creatures other than you can now benefit from the potent version of your potions.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Berserker
entries: For some barbarians, rage is a means to an end—that end being violence. The Path of the Berserker is a path of untrammeled fury, slick with blood. As you enter the berserker's rage, you thrill in the chaos of battle, heedless of your own health or well-being.

subclassFeature.name: Frenzy
entries: {@i 3rd-level Berserker feature}

You go into a frenzy when in battle. If you use reckless attack while your rage is active, you can deal extra damage to the first target you hit on your turn with a Strength-based attack. The extra damage is {@dice 2d6} at level three, and increases by {@dice 1d6} whenever your Wrath die scales.

subclassFeature.name: Mindless Rage
entries: {@i 6th-level Berserker feature}

You have immunity to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions while your Rage is active. If you are {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} when you enter your rage, that condition ends on you.

subclassFeature.name: Retaliation
entries: {@i 10th-level Berserker feature}
When you take damage from a creature that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to make one melee weapon attack against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: {@i 14th-level Berserker feature}

You can strike terror into others with your menacing presence as you swell with primal power as a bonus action. When you do so, each creature that you can see within 30 feet of you, or 60 feet of you if you are raging must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier), provided the creature isn't behind total cover. On a failed save, a creature has the {@condition frightened} condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of the creature's turns, the creature repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest. If you've run out of uses of this feature, you can expend a use of your rage, choosing to activate intimidation presence instead of rage.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Shield
entries: {@i 6th-level Ancestral Guardian feature}

The guardian spirits that aid you can provide supernatural protection to those you defend. If you are raging and another creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to reduce that damage by {@dice 2d6}. You can expend and roll any number of your wrath charges to further reduce the damage dealt.
When you reach certain levels in this class, you can reduce the damage by more: by {@dice 3d6} at 10th level and by {@dice 4d6} at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Consult the Spirits
entries: {@i 10th-level Ancestral Guardian feature}
You gain the ability to consult with your ancestral spirits. You gain the following features.

items: You gain the ability to cast the {@spell augury} or {@spell clairvoyance} spell, without using a spell slot or material components. Rather than creating a spherical sensor, this use of {@spell clairvoyance} invisibly summons one of your ancestral spirits to the chosen location. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells. After you cast either spell in this way, you can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.
Your Ancestral Protectors feature now applies on every attack you make while raging, rather than the first one on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Storm Herald
entries: {@i 6th-level Ancestral Guardian feature}

All barbarians harbor a fury within. Their rage grants them superior strength, durability, and speed. Barbarians who follow the Path of the Storm Herald learn to transform that rage into a mantle of primal magic, which swirls around them. When in a fury, a barbarian of this path taps into the forces of nature to create powerful magical effects.

Storm heralds are typically elite champions who train alongside druids, rangers, and others sworn to protect nature. Other storm heralds hone their craft in lodges in regions wracked by storms, in the frozen reaches at the world's end, or deep in the hottest deserts.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Aura
entries: {@i 3rd-level Storm Herald feature}
You emanate a stormy, magical aura while you rage. The aura extends 10 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover.

Your aura has an effect that activates when you enter your rage, and you can activate the effect again on each of your turns as a bonus action. Choose desert, sea, or tundra. Your aura's effect depends on that chosen environment, as detailed below. You can change your environment choice whenever you enter rage.
If your aura's effects require a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Desert
entries: When this effect is activated, creatures of your choice in your aura each take fire damage equal to 1 roll of your Wrath die. The damage increases when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to 2 rolls at 6th level  and 3 rolls at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Sea
entries: When this effect is activated, you can choose one other creature you can see in your aura. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage on a failed save and cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to {@dice 3d6} at 6th level, {@dice 4d6} at 14th level, and {@dice 5d6} at 20th level.

subclassFeature.name: Tundra
entries: When this effect is activated, each creature of your choice in your aura gains  temporary hit points equal to 1 roll of your Wrath die, as icy spirits inure it to suffering. The temporary hit points increase when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to 2 rolls at 6th level and 3 rolls at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Soul
entries: {@i 6th-level Storm Herald feature}
The storm grants you benefits even when your aura isn't active. The benefits are based on the environment you chose for your Storm Aura.

subclassFeature.name: Desert
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage, and you don't suffer the effects of extreme heat, as described in the Dungeon Master's Guide. Moreover, as an action, you can touch a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried by anyone else and set it on fire.

subclassFeature.name: Sea
entries: You gain resistance to lightning and Thunder damage, and you can breathe underwater. You also gain a swimming speed of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Tundra
entries: You gain resistance to cold damage, and you don't suffer the effects of extreme cold, as described in the Dungeon Master's Guide. Moreover, as an action, you can touch water and turn a 5-foot cube of it into ice, which melts after 1 minute. This action fails if a creature is in the cube.

subclassFeature.name: Shielding Storm
entries: {@i 10th-level Storm Herald feature}
You learn to use your mastery of the storm to protect others. Each creature of your choice has the damage resistance you gained from the Storm Soul feature while the creature is in your Storm Aura.

Additionally, Whenever you gain a wrath charge from taking damage, you can choose to use a reaction and immediately expend the charge, activating the effects of the aura you have selected at the moment.

subclassFeature.name: Raging Storm
entries: {@i 14th-level Storm Herald feature}
The power of the storm you channel grows mightier, lashing out at your foes. The effect is based on the environment you chose for your Storm Aura.
Additionally, you can change your aura whenever you activate it with your bonus action, rather than whenever you rage.

subclassFeature.name: Desert
entries: Immediately after a creature in your aura hits you with an attack, you can force that creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes fire damage equal to half your barbarian level.

subclassFeature.name: Sea
entries: When you hit a creature in your aura with an attack, you can force that creature to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked {@condition prone}, as if struck by a wave.

subclassFeature.name: Tundra
entries: Whenever the effect of your Storm Aura is activated, you can choose one creature you can see in the aura. That creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn, as magical frost covers it.

subclassFeature.name: Fanatical Focus
entries: {@i 6th-level Zealot feature}

The divine power that fuels your rage can protect you. If you fail a saving throw while you're raging, you can expend a wrath charge to reroll it with a bonus to the saving throw equal to the number rolled on the wrath die. If this causes you to succeed the save, you cannot use this feature again during this rage.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Beast
entries: Barbarians who walk the Path of the Beast draw their rage from a bestial spark burning within their souls. That beast bursts forth in the throes of rage, physically transforming the barbarian.
Such a barbarian might be inhabited by a primal spirit or be descended from shape-shifters. You can choose the origin of your feral might or determine it by rolling on the Origin of the Beast table.

entries.caption: Origin of the Beast
rows: One of your parents is a lycanthrope, and you've inherited some of their curse.
You are descended from an archdruid and inherited the ability to partially change shape.
A fey spirit gifted you with the ability to adopt different bestial aspects.
An ancient animal spirit dwells within you, allowing you to walk this path.

subclassFeature.name: Form of the Beast
entries: {@i 3rd-level Path of the Beast feature}

When you enter your rage, you can transform, revealing the bestial power within you. Until the rage ends, you manifest a natural weapon. It counts as a simple melee weapon for you, and you add your Strength modifier to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with it, as normal. Additionally, if you take the attack action on your turn, you can use your bonus action to make one weapon attack with your chosen natural weapon.
You choose the weapon's form each time you rage:

items.name: Bite
items.entry: Your mouth transforms into a bestial muzzle or great mandibles (your choice). It deals {@damage 1d8} piercing damage on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature with this bite, you regain a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus, provided you have less than half your hit points when you hit.

items.name: Claws
items.entry: Each of your hands transforms into a claw, which you can use as a weapon if it's empty. It deals {@damage 2d4} slashing damage on a hit, which increases to {@damage 2d6} when you reach 10th level in this class.

items.name: Tail
items.entry: You grow a lashing, spiny tail, which deals {@damage 1d8} piercing damage on a hit and has the reach property. If a creature you can see within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to swipe your tail and roll a {@dice d8}, applying a bonus to your AC equal to the number rolled, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Soul
entries: {@i 6th-level Path of the Beast feature}

The feral power within you increases, causing the natural weapons of your Form of the Beast to count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. In addition, you can now make an additional attack with your natural weapon as part of the attack action, rather than a bonus action.

You can also alter your form to help you adapt to your surroundings. When you finish a short or long rest, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you finish your next short or long rest:

items: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe underwater.
You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
When you jump, you can make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check and extend your jump by a number of feet equal to the check's total. You can make this special check only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Call the Hunt
entries: {@i 14th-level Path of the Beast feature}

The beast within you grows so powerful that you can spread its ferocity to others and gain resilience from them joining your hunt. When you enter your rage, you can choose a number of other willing creatures you can see equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of one creature).

You gain 5 temporary hit points for each creature that accepts this feature. Until the rage ends, the chosen creatures can each use the following benefit once on each of their turns: when the creature hits a target with an attack roll and deals damage to it, the creature can roll a {@dice d10} and gain a bonus to the damage equal to the number rolled.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Path of Wild Magic
entries: Many places in the multiverse abound with beauty, intense emotion, and rampant magic; the Feywild, the Upper Planes, and other realms of supernatural power radiate with such forces and can profoundly influence people. As folk of deep feeling, barbarians are especially susceptible to these wild influences, with some barbarians being transformed by the magic. These magic-suffused barbarians walk the Path of Wild Magic. Elf, tiefling, aasimar, and genasi barbarians often seek this path, eager to manifest the otherworldly magic of their ancestors.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Surge
entries: {@i 3rd-level Path of Wild Magic feature}
The magical energy roiling inside you sometimes erupts from you. When you enter your rage, roll on the Wild Magic table to determine the magical effect produced.
If the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.

entries.caption: Wild Magic
rows: Shadowy tendrils lash around you. Each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage. You also gain {@dice 1d12} temporary hit points.
You teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Until your rage ends, you can use this effect again on each of your turns as a bonus action.

An intangible spirit, which looks like a {@creature flumph} or a {@creature pixie} (your choice), appears within 5 feet of one creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. At the end of the current turn, the spirit explodes, and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} force damage. Until your rage ends, you can use this effect again, summoning another spirit, on each of your turns as a bonus action.

Magic infuses one weapon of your choice that you are holding. Until your rage ends, the weapon's damage type changes to force, and it gains the light and thrown properties, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If the weapon leaves your hand, the weapon reappears in your hand at the end of the current turn.
Whenever a creature hits you with an attack roll before your rage ends, that creature takes {@damage 1d6} force damage, as magic lashes out in retribution.

Until your rage ends, you are surrounded by multi colored, protective lights; Roll a Wrath die. You gain a bonus to your AC equal to half the number rolled (rounded down, minimum of 1), and while within 10 feet of you, your allies gain the same bonus.
Flowers and vines temporarily grow around you. Until your rage ends, the ground within 15 feet of you is {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for your enemies.

A bolt of light shoots from your chest. Another creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} radiant damage and be {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn. Until your rage ends, you can use this effect again on each of your turns as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Bolstering Magic
entries: {@i 6th-level Path of Wild Magic feature}

You can harness your wild magic to bolster yourself or a companion. As an action, you can touch one creature (which can be yourself) and confer one of the following benefits of your choice to that creature:

items: For 10 minutes, the creature can roll a {@dice d4} whenever making an attack roll or an ability check and add the number rolled to the {@dice d20} roll.

Roll a {@dice d3}. The creature regains one expended spell slot, the level of which equals the number rolled or lower (the creature's choice). Once a creature receives this benefit, that creature can't receive it again until after a long rest.

entries: You can take this action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Overloaded Surge
entries: {@i 10th-level Path of Wild Magic feature}
The magical energy roiling inside you is stronger than ever. The features you gain from your Wild Magic table are improved in the following ways.

entries.caption: Wild Magic
rows: You can use this effect again as a bonus action on subsequent turns.
You teleport a willing creature that you can touch up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see rather than yourself.
The damage is increased to {@dice 2d6}, and the area is increased to 10 feet. It now also deals half damage if they succeed on the saving throw.
The weapon can now benefit from Reckless attack even when thrown, and no longer gains disadvantage from the long range.
You can now expend a Wrath charge as a bonus action to treat the AC bonus as if you rolled the maximum number on your Wrath die until the start of your next turn.
Any creature that moves 10 feet while within this area must make a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Totem Warrior
entries: The Path of the Totem Warrior is a spiritual journey, as the barbarian accepts a spirit animal as guide, protector, and inspiration. In battle, your totem spirit fills you with supernatural might, adding magical fuel to your barbarian rage.
Most barbarian tribes consider a totem animal to be kin to a particular clan. In such cases, it is unusual for an individual to have more than one totem animal spirit, though exceptions exist.

subclassFeature.name: Totem Spirit
entries: {@i 3rd-level Totem Warrior feature}

When you adopt this path, you choose a totem spirit and gain its feature. You must make or acquire a physical totem object—an amulet or similar adornment—that incorporates fur or feathers, claws, teeth, or bones of the totem animal. At your option, you also gain minor physical attributes that are reminiscent of your totem spirit. For example, if you have a bear totem spirit, you might be unusually hairy and thick-skinned, or if your totem is the eagle, your eyes turn bright yellow.
Your totem animal might be an animal related to those listed here but more appropriate to your homeland. For example, you could choose a hawk or vulture in place of an eagle.

subclassFeature.name: Bear
entries: When you enter a rage, you can choose two damage types except psychic to gain resistance to for the duration of the rage.

subclassFeature.name: Eagle
entries: While you're raging and aren't wearing heavy armor, you can take both the {@action Dash} and {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on your turn. The spirit of the eagle makes you into a predator who can weave through the fray with ease.

subclassFeature.name: Elk
entries: While you're raging and aren't wearing heavy armor, your walking speed increases by 15 feet, and you can ignore the movement penalty of non-magical difficult terrain. The spirit of the elk makes you extraordinarily swift.

subclassFeature.name: Tiger
entries: While raging, you can add 10 feet to your long jump distance and 3 feet to your high jump distance. Whenever you land within 10 feet of a hostile creature after jumping, you gain a Wrath charge. The spirit of the tiger empowers your leaps.

subclassFeature.name: Wolf
entries: While you're raging, your friends have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature within 10 feet of you that is hostile to you. The spirit of the wolf makes you a leader of hunters.

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of the Beast
entries: {@i 6th-level Totem Warrior feature}
You gain a magical benefit based on a totem animal of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Elephant
entries: You gain the might of an elephant. Your carrying capacity (including maximum load and maximum lift) is doubled, and you have advantage on Strength checks made to push, pull, lift, or break objects.

subclassFeature.name: Owl
entries: You gain the eyesight of an Owl. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Insight} or {@skill Perception} skill. If you already have proficiency in the chosen skill, you gain Expertise in it. Additionally, if your darkvision has a range under 120 feet, its range is now 120 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Ibex
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws against the {@condition grappled} or {@condition prone} conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Lion
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics} skill. If you already have proficiency in the chosen skill, you gain expertise in it instead.

subclassFeature.name: Fox
entries: You gain the hunting sensibilities of a Fox. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} or {@skill Survival} skill. If you already have proficiency in the chosen skill, you gain expertise in it instead.

subclassFeature.name: Totemic Attunement
entries: {@i 14th-level Totem Warrior feature}
You gain a magical benefit based on a totem animal of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Moose
