entries: The roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.
action.name: Multiattack

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.
action.name: Beak

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the roc can't use its talons on another target.
action.name: Talons

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage the target is {@condition grappled} and pulled 60ft towards the roc in a straight line. If there are any obstacles on the way, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} extra damage for each obstacle.
action.name: Vine Whip

entries: The roc makes a vine attack or a talon attack
legendary.name: Attack

entries: The Roc can pull one {@condition grappled} creature 60 ft towards it and restrain it.
legendary.name: Vine pull (1 Action)

entries: The Roc grounds itself and digs its vines into the ground. Every creature within 60ft of the roc needs to succeed on a dexterity saving throw {@dc 19} or be {@condition grappled}.
legendary.name: Take root (2 Actions)

entries: All Creatures within 60ft of the roc are pulled 10 ft into the ground and are {@condition restrained}.
legendary.name: Meet the earth (3 Actions)

entries: As a reaction when attacked, the roc can use the vines to form a carapace around it. the carapace has 30 hit points and an AC of 20. Melee attacks at it are made with advantage.
reaction.name: Vine Defence

fly.condition: Hover when 20ft close to the ground

entries: Roll a {@dice d100} at the start of your turn. On a 50 or higher, the Roc can end one effect on itself or dispel one effect it can see within 60ft. The tsochari learn from all thier fallen
trait.name: Adaptation

entries: The tsochari roc has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
trait.name: Keen Sight

entries: The Rot Devourer makes three attacks: Two with its claws and one with its tail.
action.name: Multiattack

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage. A creature that suffers the acid damage must make a constitution saving throw ({@dc 17}). If the creature fails on three consecutive saving throws, the creature is considered diseased. A diseased creature gets a  -3 from all Ability checks, Saving throws and attack rolls.
action.name: Claws

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.
action.name: Tail Swipe

entries: You point at a location within range, and a glowing 1-foot-diameter ball of emerald acid streaks there and explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 12d4} acid damage and another {@damage 5d4} acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.
action.name: Vitriolic Sphere {@recharge}

entries: The Rot devourer jumps into a fleshy wall and emerges from another one 30 feet away, dealing a claws attack immediately.
legendary.name: Flesh burrowing

entries: The Rot devourer sings a low-frequency song. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. If the target is hurt, it can repeat the saving throw. Target who succeeds in a saving throw is immune to the song for 1 day.
legendary.name: Paralyzing song (costs 2 actions)

entries: The rot devourer can breathe air and water.
trait.name: Amphibious

entries: If the rot devourer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)

entries: When the flesh salamander takes bludgeoning, piercing, slashing or force damage, each creature in melee takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.
trait.name: Acidic Splash

entries: Jiro can make 2 slam attacks and use rock trap if available
action.name: Multiattack

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.
action.name: Slam

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 5d6 + 4}) piercing damage. Regardless of a miss or a hit, the creature needs to make a Desterity saving throw {@dc 17} or be net'd, {@condition restrained} and {@condition prone}
action.name: Jade Bolt

entries: jiro targets one creature within 10ft and traps it in an encasing of jade. The creature has full cover from attacks and area of effects that rely on sight. The cage has 50 Hitpoints and has an AC of 18
action.name: Rocktrap {@recharge 6}

entries: During its first turn, the jiro has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the jiro scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.
trait.name: Assassinate

entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the jiro's darkvision.
trait.name: Devil's Sight

entries: The Overseer can make 2 slash attacks or use break defences with 1 attack
action.name: Multiattack

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) slashing damage.
action.name: Sword

entries: The Overseer puts a shield on a pawn on the board for 2 rounds. the shield can be broken with any spell of lvl 2 or higher or the  dispel special action.
action.name: Sicilian Defence

entries: the overseer protects himself in a force shield for 2 rounds. the Shield can be removed with a spell of 4th level of higher.
action.name: Scandanavian Defence

entries: The overseer opens its cavity and allows the king to make an attack
action.name: Kings Gambit {@recharge 5}

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 7d8 + 5}) piercing damage.
action.name: King's Gambit attack

entries: The overseer subjects one creature to mindshattering pain. The creature must make a {@dc 19} constitution saving throw or lose 10 AC till the end of the overseer's next round
action.name: Break Defences

headerEntries: The Overseer's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 19} and {@hit 11} to hit). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting

entries: If a pawn reaches the end of the board, it becomes one size larger and can use its action to self destruct. It  explodes in a 20ft radius and deals  {@damage 8d8} Fire damage on a Dexterity save of {@dc 15}
trait.name: Pawn Upgrade self destruct

entries: Pawns have a move speed of 20ft and if it enters an unclaimed tile, it claims it.
trait.name: Pawn travel

entries: A claimed tile will extend spikes at Initiative count 20 dealing {@dice 12d10} on a failed Dexterity saving throw or half as much on a successful one. Pushing the creature to the nearest tile.
Additionally, it deals {@damage 3d8} fire damage at  the start of a creature's turn
trait.name: Spike Floor
Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ostinato can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Invisibility
entries: The ostinato is {@condition invisible} as per a greater invisibility spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ostinato has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ostinato makes two cacophony ray attacks.

action.name: Cacophony Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage.

action.name: Aural Symbiosis (1/Day)
entries: One humanoid that the ostinato can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or the ostinato merges with it, becoming an enjoyable, repetitive tune in its host's mind. The ostinato can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect. The target retains control of its body and is aware of the ostinato's presence only as a melody, not as a living entity. The target no longer needs to eat or drink, gains the ostinato's Magic Resistance trait, and has advantage on Charisma checks. It also has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and it can't maintain concentration on spells or other effects for more than a single turn. The target can make a {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check once every 24 hours; on a success, it realizes that the music it hears comes from an external entity.

The Aural Symbiosis lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points, the ostinato ends it as a bonus action, or the ostinato is forced out by a dispel evil and good spell or comparable magic. When the Aural Symbiosis ends, the ostinato bursts forth in a thunderous explosion of sound and reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target. All creatures within 60 feet, including the original target, take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) thunder damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. The target becomes immune to this ostinato's Aural Symbiosis for 24 hours if it succeeds on the saving throw or after the Aural Symbiosis ends.

action.name: Voracious Aura (1/Day)
entries: While merged with a humanoid (see Aural Symbiosis), the ostinato feeds on nearby creatures. Up to nine creatures of the ostinato's choice within 60 feet of it can be targeted. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage and have its hit point maximum reduced by the same amount until it finishes a long rest. The target dies if its maximum hit points are reduced to 0. Victims notice this damage immediately, but not its source.

hp.special: 5 + five times your Barbarian level (the drake has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to your barbarian level)

trait.name: Essence of Calamity
entries: While you are in rage, your steed also gains resistance to bludgeoning, slashing and piercing damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the horse moves at least 20 feet straight towards a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 + PB Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Hastening
entries: The horse's movespeed increases by 10 times your Proficiency bonus.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} +4 plus PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@dice 2d6} plus PB Bludgeoning damage.

weapon.name: Arcane Cannon
weapon.crew: 3x Lvl 1-7 spellcasters or 1x lvl 8+ spell caster
entries: It takes 1 action to choose the firing mode, 1 action to aim it, and 1 action to fire it. If the user is a spellcaster of level 8 or highter, then they may do all these three on one action. When the airship is started, this arcane cannon whirls to life with 20 charges. Each use of the arcane cannon consumes a portion of this charge based on the firing mode.
The Arcane Cannon's effects have a saving DC of 19 and a +11 to hit on attacks.

action.name: Firing Mode : Chain Lightning (6 Charges)
entries: You create a bolt of lightning that arcs toward a target of your choice that you can see within 150ft. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the bolts.
A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 10d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Firing Mode : Chain Enervation (7 Charges)
entries: You fire a bolt of negative energy at one creature you can see within 200ft. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the bolt does {@damage 12d6} necrotic damage and the creature must make a successful Constitution saving throw or gain two levels of {@condition exhaustion}. The bolt then leaps to another target within 50 feet of the previous target that hasn't already been targeted by the spell; if more than one is available, you may choose which target to attack. The effect continues attacking creatures one after another in a chain until it misses or there are no more creatures eligible to be hit.

action.name: Firing Mode : Circle of Death (6 Charges)
entries: A sphere of negative energy ripples out in a 60-foot-radius sphere from a point within 150 feet range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Firing Mode : Cloak bubble (4 Charges)
entries: The entire ship becomes {@condition invisible} until the spell ends (1 hour). Anything the ship is carrying is {@condition invisible} as long as it is on the ship.

action.name: Firing Mode : Deadline (5 Charges)
entries: You fire a 1-inch-wide, 60-foot-long beam of senescent energy that pierces through creatures, objects, and structures alike at untraceable speed. An object or structure pierced by the beam has its AC permanently reduced by 4 if it is inorganic. If it is organic, the point pierced by the beam and the object or structure's material within 1 foot of the beam decays and ages until it is brittle enough to break by a light touch.

A creature pierced by the beam must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 10d8} necrotic damage and instantly ages {@dice 2d4 x 10} years on a failed save; if this damage would reduce a creature to 0 hit points, it falls {@condition unconscious} and is stable instead of dying, and it ages an additional year for each point of damage it took in excess of its current hit points. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't aged.

The aging can be reversed with the greater restoration spell or more powerful magic, but only if it is cast within 24 hours of failing the saving throw. After that time, only a wish spell can reverse the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the chain
entries: You learn the {@spell find familiar} spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

When you cast the spell, you can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, {@creature quasit}, or {@creature sprite}.
Additionally, when you take the {@action Attack} action or cast {@spell eldritch blast}, you allow your familiar to use its reaction to make one attack of its own.

optionalfeature.name: Protection of the Blade
entries: You gain proficiency in Medium armor.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Blade (variant)
entries: You can use your action to create a pact weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this melee weapon takes each time you create it (see chapter 5 for weapon options). You are proficient with it while you wield it. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. Additionally, when you attack with that weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

Your pact weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die.

You can transform one magic weapon into your pact weapon by performing a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. You can then dismiss the weapon, shunting it into an extradimensional space, and it appears whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the talisman
entries: Your patron gives you an amulet, a talisman that can aid the wearer when the need is great. When the wearer fails an ability check, they can add a {@dice d6} to the roll, potentially turning the roll into a success. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

If you lose the talisman, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous amulet. The talisman turns to ash when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the tome
entries: Your patron gives you a grimoire called a Book of Shadows. When you gain this feature, choose three {@filter cantrips|spells|level=0} from any class's spell list. The cantrips do not need to be from the same spell list. While the book is on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They don't count against your number of cantrips known. Any cantrip you cast with this feature is considered a warlock cantrip for you. You can also use an action to tear a page from the book of shadows to regain a warlock spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot gain another warlock spell slot through this feature until you finish a long rest. If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turns to ash when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Banishing Arrow
entries: You use abjuration magic to try to temporarily banish your target to a harmless location in the Feywild. The creature hit by the arrow must also succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished in this way, the target's speed is 0, and it is {@condition incapacitated}. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
After you reach 10th level in this class, a target also takes {@damage d6} force damage when the arrow hits it. This damage increases to {@damage 2d6} at 18th level.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Arrow
entries: Your enchantment magic causes this arrow to temporarily beguile its target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, and choose one of your allies within 30 feet of the target. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it is {@condition charmed} by the chosen ally until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if the chosen ally attacks the {@condition charmed} target, deals damage to it, or forces it to make a saving throw.
The psychic damage increases to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Bursting Arrow
entries: You imbue your arrow with force energy drawn from the school of evocation. The energy detonates after your attack. Immediately after the arrow hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take {@damage 2d6} force damage each.
The force damage increases to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Enfeebling Arrow
entries: You weave necromantic magic into your arrow. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the damage dealt by its weapon attacks is halved until the start of your next turn.
The necrotic damage increases to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Arrow
entries: When this arrow strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, poisonous brambles, which wrap around the target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} poison damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it takes {@damage 2d6} slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can reach it can use its action to remove the brambles with a successful Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your Arcane Shot save DC. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute or until you use this option again.
The poison damage and slashing damage both increase to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Arrow
entries: You use transmutation magic to give your arrow an ethereal quality. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the arrow shoots forward in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The arrow passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@damage 2d6} piercing damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
The piercing damage increases to {@damage 4d6} and {@damage 6d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Arrow
entries: Using divination magic, you grant your arrow the ability to seek out a target. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, choose one creature you have seen in the past minute. The arrow flies toward that creature, moving around corners if necessary and ignoring three-quarters cover and half cover. If the target is within the weapon's range and there is a path large enough for the arrow to travel to the target, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. Otherwise, the arrow disappears after traveling as far as it can. On a failed save, the target takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage, and you learn the target's current location. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and you don't learn its location.
The force damage increases to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Arrow
entries: You weave illusion magic into your arrow, causing it to occlude your foe's vision with shadows. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, and a 5 ft dome of magical darkness appears at the creature's space until the start of your next turn.
The psychic damage increases to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Careful Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the spell's full force. To do so, you spend 1 sorcery point and choose a number of those creatures up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the spell, and it takes no damage if it would normally take half damage on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can spend 1 sorcery point to double its duration, to a maximum duration of 24 hours.
If the affected spell requires concentration, you have advantage on any saving throw you make to maintain that concentration.

optionalfeature.name: Heightened Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist its effects, you can spend 2 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Spell
entries: If you make an attack roll for a spell and miss, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll the {@dice d20}, and you must use the new roll.
You can use Seeking Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Transmuted Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, you can spend 1 sorcery point to change that damage type to one of the other listed types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder.
You can use Transmuted Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Twinned Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).
If you twin a spell that requires concentration, you make concentration checks to maintain that spell at disadvantage.

To be eligible, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level. For example, {@spell magic missile} and {@spell scorching ray} aren't eligible, but {@spell ray of frost} and {@spell chromatic orb} are.

optionalfeature.name: Blaze Reprisal
entries: 1-2: Adds {@dice 1d8} fire damage to attacks.
3-4: Attacks cause targets to ignite, dealing {@dice 1d8} fire damage at the start of their next turn.
5: Attacks create a blaze around the target, dealing {@dice 2d8} fire damage to enemies within 10 feet.
6: Unleash a fiery explosion, dealing {@dice 4d8} fire damage to all enemies within 30 feet of you. Requires a Dexterity saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Glacial Guard
entries: 1-2: Gain +1 AC and deal {@dice 1d4} cold damage to melee attackers.
3-4: Attacks slow the target, reducing their speed by 10 feet until your next turn.
5: Freeze the ground, making it difficult terrain in a 15-foot radius around the target.
6: Encase targets in ice on hit, {@condition stunned} for 1 turn. Requires a Constitution saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Tempest Fury
entries: 1-2: Increase movement speed by 10 feet. Attacks add {@dice 1d4} lightning damage.
3-4: Attacks push enemies back 10 feet.
5: Gain advantage on all Dexterity saving throws and skill checks.
6: Create a tempest on hit, dealing {@dice 2d8} lightning damage to the target and up to two additional enemies within 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Bulwark
entries: 1-2: Gain +2 to all saving throws. Resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
3-4: Attacks fortify you, granting temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Constitution modifier.
5: Attacks cause the earth to grasp enemies, reducing their speed to 0 until the end of their next turn.
6: Trigger a localized earthquake, knocking enemies within 20 feet prone. Requires a Strength saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Void Embrace
entries: 1-2: Attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage, healing you for half the amount dealt.
3-4: Diminish enemy strength, reducing their damage output by {@dice 1d4} for 1 turn.
5: Silence enemies hit, preventing them from casting spells for 1 turn. Requires a Wisdom saving throw.
6: Consume life force, dealing {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage to all enemies within 15 feet. You gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Solar Flare
entries: 1-2: Add {@dice 1d6} radiant damage to attacks. Dispel magical darkness in a 10-foot radius.
3-4: Illuminate targets, granting advantage on attacks against them and dealing {@dice 1d6} additional radiant damage.
5: Enemies hit are {@condition blinded} for 1 turn. Requires a Constitution saving throw.
6: A radiant burst expands from you, blinding all enemies within 20 feet and dealing {@dice 3d8} radiant damage. Requires a Constitution saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Aether Wind
entries: 1-2: Attacks extend your reach by 5 feet and add {@dice 1d4} force damage.
3-4: Generate an updraft with each hit, allowing you to ignore difficult terrain.
5: Gain a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 turn.
6: Create a vortex on hit, pulling up to three enemies within 30 feet towards the target. Requires a Strength saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Bind
entries: 1-2: Attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} poison damage and slow enemies by 10 feet.
3-4: Entangle enemies hit, reducing their speed to 0 until they succeed on a Strength saving throw.
5: Vines grapple the target, {@condition restraining} them for 1 turn. Requires a Strength saving throw.
6: A massive vine burst restrains all enemies within 20 feet, dealing {@dice 3d6} poison damage. Requires a Strength saving throw.
